title.native: まいっちんぐマチコ先生

description:
Based on the manga by Takeshi Ebihara.

Mai Machiko is the newest teacher at Asama Elementary; she's young, beautiful, and has the perfect proportions - traits that attract the attention of not only her students, but the rest of the perverted faculty as well. Whether it's luring her in and spraying up her skirt with a hose or leaps and bounds to grab her breasts, there's nothing that Machiko's first year students won't try to do. Regardless of her embarrassing plight, Machiko is always a good sport and tries her best to help out her students - at any cost to her dignity!

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Male Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several male characters who are romantically interested in them.

title.native: まいっちんぐマチコ先生

node.description:
[Website](http://takada-akemi.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/AngelTouchPlus)

Akemi Takada is a Japanese artist and illustrator, and was born on March 31 in Tokyo, Japan. She is a popular anime character designer who attended Tama Art University, and then worked for Tatsunoko Pro following her graduation. She is currently a freelance illustrator with her own studio, though she is also a member of the creative group Headgear. She also has her own designer jewelry store called Diakosmos.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/寺田憲史)

Terada's more notable works include writing the first three games of the Final Fantasy series. He also worked on Batman: Dark Tomorrow, created the concept for the Sega CD game Dark Wizard, and was the main script writer for the [Kimagure Orange Road](https://anilist.co/anime/1087/) series among other things.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ながきふさひろ)

Older brother of [Tatsuhiro Nagaki](https://anilist.co/staff/214258/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/杉村重郎)

A composite artist turned producer.
